      • getBoxes

        public abstract java.util.Vector<Rect> getBoxes(Dim dimension)
        For the given dimension of the entire array of boxes, return a vector of Rectangles describing the corners of each box, in row-major order.
        Parameters:
        dimension - the size of the overall array of boxes, in pixels.
        Returns:
        a Vector of Rectangles representing individual boxes, in row-major order.

      • getBoxNoContainingPoint

        public Rect getBoxNoContainingPoint(Point p,
                                    Dim d)
        Find the box within the array containing a particular point, in reverse order to the natural (drawing) order. Operating on the reversed order means that offspring precede their parents in search order. This is useful in Pedigree mode, where it is used to ensure that click order follows the reverse of drawing order, so that box-selecting is sane.
        Parameters:
        p - the point to locate within one of the particular boxes
        d - the size of the overall array of boxes, in pixels.
        Returns:
        the box number containing the given point.

      • getBoxSize

        public abstract Dim getBoxSize(Rect selectedBox,
                               Dim dimension)
        For the supplied dimension of the entire array of boxes, return the size of one (any) box. The returned box width is the dimension width divided by the number of columns, and the height is the dimension height divided by the number of rows.
        Parameters:
        selectedBox - the 0-based index of the box in the collection.
        dimension - the size of the overall array of boxes, in pixels
        Returns:
        the size of an individual box within the array.

      • getMidBox

        public abstract Rect getMidBox()

      • getMidPoint

        public abstract Point getMidPoint(Dim dimension,
                                  Rect box)
        Given supplied dimension of the entire array of boxes, return the midpoint of the nth box (starting with n = 0).
        Parameters:
        dimension - the dimensions of the overall array of boxes.
        box - the box to retrieve.
        Returns:
        the midpoint of the nth Box.

      • getMidPoints

        public abstract java.util.Vector<Point> getMidPoints(Dim dimension)
        For the given dimension of the entire array of boxes, return a vector of Points describing the midpoints of each box, in row-major order.
        Parameters:
        dimension - the dimension of the entire array of boxes, in pixels
        Returns:
        a Vector of box midpoints, in row-major order.

      • getBoxesReversed

        public java.util.Vector<Rect> getBoxesReversed(Dim scale)
        Return the boxes in reverse order, so that offspring are "on top" of their ancestors. Useful for z-ordering so that younger morphs overlap their parents in click order as well as drawing order.
        Parameters:
        scale - the size of the MorphView centre panel in pixels.
        Returns:
        the same Vector as getBoxes() in reverse order.
